commitResults.messageTitle: Rename Duke.java to Yq.java
commitResults.messageBody:
Rename chatbot Duke to Yq

Create statements that allow chatbot Yq to greet and exits

commitResults.messageTitle: Make chatbot Yq echo the command that the user inputs
commitResults.messageBody:
The chatbot Yq will echo whatever command or line that the user inputs
within a 'while' loop until the user inputs "bye" then the chatbot Yq
will stop running.

Add processForThreeSeconds() method

This acts as a processing time for chatbot Yq whenever it receives a
command from the user's input.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add the ability to store and display text
commitResults.messageBody:
The chatbot Yq is able to store the text entered by the user in a list
and display the contents in the list as requested.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Task.java which contains Task class
commitResults.messageBody:
This is more user-friendly as it allows user to work at the level of
objects while ignoring the data attributes and method implementation
details. User can store multiple attributes within a Task object and
the attributes are only accessible using the Task object's interface.

Let's create class Task and construct attributes getters and setters
and other relevant methods for the class Task.

This replaces the usage of the String to represent the task and the
Task list (array) is used instead of a String array and allows user to
interact the objects via different methods.

Replace method processForThreeSeconds() to processForOneSecond()

It is taking slightly long before the user can enter the next command.
Some user may be impatient and accidentally keys in command while the
chatbot Yq is processing an action. This could trigger error and bring
inconvenience to the user.

Reduce 3-seconds delay to a 1-second delay.

This reduces the waiting time of the user while giving more realism as
program requires time to process an action or command input by the user.

Create methods printList(), addTask(), markTask() and unmarkTask()

By compiling the codes into different methods, it is more readable,
cleaner and user-friendly as requested to display task list contents,
add task into the task list, mark task as done and mark task as not
done. Try and catch exceptions are added in markTask() and unmarkTask()
to prevent invalid input number by the user as it involves the user's
input to extract the Task with their corresponding position from the
Task list.

Make each action or command by the user as a method.

More methods may be implemented in the future and certain methods would
require some sort of output such as an Array (Task List). It is also
more convenient to add on more methods if more commands are needed for
the chatbot Yq.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add more customisations such as command options display and step-by-step user input prompt in Yq.java
commitResults.messageBody:
This makes the chatbot Yq user-friendly as the user becomes aware of the
command it accepts. For 'mark', 'unmark' and 'add' commands, the user
can input the number or task when prompted after entering the respective
command.

commitResults.messageTitle: Make minor adjustments to the code to comply with Java Coding Standard
commitResults.messageBody:
Remove empty lines in the codes and ensure the codes follow the
conventions.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refine markTask() and unmarkTask() methods in Yq.java
commitResults.messageBody:
The condition, whereby the task list is empty, located outside the
markTask() and unmarkTask() methods is unnecessary as it is already
accounted for in both methods. Also, it is inconvenient for the user to
keep entering the 'mark' and 'unmark' command whenever the user keys in
an invalid number to extract the task to be marked as done or not done.

Remove the exterior if-condition when the task list is empty and
implement a while loop which encapsulates the try-catch statements
within the markTask() and unmarkTask() methods.

A while loop encapsulating the try-catch statements in both methods
allows the user to input a valid number after keying in the wrong number
without the need to exit the markTask() or unmarkTask() method and key
in the command again.

Change methods from setIsDone() to setDone() and getIsDone() to isDone()
in Task.java

This is to improve readability and ensures that the method name follows
the coding standard.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add child classes of Task class: ToDo, Deadline and Event
commitResults.messageBody:
These classes are required for Level-4 increment and inheritance is used
as Todo, Deadline and Event classes have similar methods and attributes
as the parent Task class.

toString() method is included in all these classes to accommodate the
differences in the method implementation between the parent class and
the child classes via overriding.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement checker methods to validate user input command in Yq.java
commitResults.messageBody:
Methods such as isValidMarkCommand(), isValidUnmarkCommand(),
isValidTodoCommand(), isValidDeadlineCommand() and isValidEventCommand()
ensure that the user input follows the command format as requested by
Chatbot Yq.

Include methods to create Todo, Deadline and Event tasks such as
createTodo(), createDeadline(), createEvent()

The respective method is executed once the user input command passes the
corresponding checking method.

Refine codes in Yq.java

Some codes are extracted and encapsulated into methods such as
printWelcomeMessage() and printCommandOptions().

Certain methods such as markTask() and unmarkTask(), which used to
perform 2 different functions (checking user input validity and
mark/unmark), are simplified to perform marking/unmarking of Task
while the methods isValidMarkCommand() and isValidUnmarkCommand()
are in charge of checking the user input validity.

These changes are made to ensure that each method only performs a
function that their name suggests, so the code will be more readable.

commitResults.messageTitle: Create automated Text UI Testing for Yq.java
commitResults.messageBody:
The automated Text UI testing ensures that the actual output matches the
expected output and its implementation fulfils the requirement for
A-TextUiTesting.

This allows easier identification of the regions of the codes in Yq.java
that require modification, so the actual output would match the expected
output.

commitResults.messageTitle: Make some minor adjustments and refinements to ensure high code quality
commitResults.messageBody:
This is to ensure that the codes adhere to the Java coding standards and
are of high code quality.

Add method definitions and explanations in Yq.java

The definitions and explanations of the methods allow reviewers and
users to understand at a greater detail in what the methods do and how
they work.

commitResults.messageTitle: Make some minor code refactoring and other tweaks based on peer review
commitResults.messageBody:
Some of the variable names are shortened for better readability.
Numbers are assigned with meaningful variable names to prevent magic
numbers.
To avoid arrowhead code style, isValidInputInteger() method, which
checks for valid input integer in both 'mark' and 'unmark' commands,
is being extracted from the isValidUnmarkCmd() and isValidMarkCmd()
methods, hence simplifying them.
The expected output in the EXPECTED.TXT are also adjusted based on the
changes made in Yq.java accordingly.

commitResults.messageTitle: Convert parent class Task to abstract class Task
commitResults.messageBody: This is to prevent initialisation of Task class object.

commitResults.messageTitle: Create exception methods in YqException.java
commitResults.messageBody:
The exception methods will be required later on for the chatbot Yq to
handle user inputs with errors under the A-Exceptions increment.

commitResults.messageTitle: Change ToDo class to Todo class
Merge branch 'branch-Level-5'
Modify the methods so they can handle errors by throwing exceptions
commitResults.messageBody:
The methods returnValidCommand(), markTask(), unmarkTask(),
createTodo(), createDeadline(), createEvent() and printList() contain
exceptions which will be throw according to the error found in the
user's input.

Each of the method above has a corresponding method that contains
try-and-catch statements which handles the abnormality detected in the
user's input by printing the respective error messages after the
exception is thrown while an action is executed.

commitResults.messageTitle: Edit input.txt and EXPECTED.TXT by incorporating the changes in Yq.java
commitResults.messageBody:
Certain input statements have been added or modified to accommodate
the changes made to the code in Yq.java.

commitResults.messageTitle: Make all exceptions subclasses of YqException public and stores them into a package named "yq.exceptions"
commitResults.messageBody:
This is to allow the usage of exceptions by Yq.java as it is stored in
another package called "yq.ui".

commitResults.messageTitle: Store the Task class and its subclasses in a package called "yq.tasks"
Store Yq.java in a package called "yq.ui"
Account for the changes in the location of Yq.java
Merge branch 'branch-A-Packages'
Replace an array with an ArrayList for storing tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
ArrayList allows benefits that are not present in an array such as
dynamic sizing and easy to find, add and delete tasks.

It is also a requirement for A-Collections.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refine methods that involve the task ArrayList
commitResults.messageBody:
The parameter for the task ArrayList is removed from those methods and
the ArrayList variables present in the codes within those methods are
replaced with an inline ArrayList variable instead, which is the private
static final task ArrayList declared in the Yq class.

This ensures readability and the methods in Yq.class only function on
that specific task ArrayList.

commitResults.messageTitle: Edit the file path of Yq.java in both runtest.bat and runtest.sh
commitResults.messageBody:
This is to account for the change in the file location of Yq.java after
it is being moved into the ui package, so the test cases can run
smoothly.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add MissingDeleteNumberException.java into the exceptions package
commitResults.messageBody:
This exception will be thrown by a method that deletes task whenever the
index of the task to be deleted is missing from the user input.

commitResults.messageTitle: Include methods and features related to deleting task
commitResults.messageBody:
Methods such as deleteTask() and checkValidDeleteCmd() are added into
Yq.java. deleteTask() deletes the task based on the index selected by
the user and throws exception whenever an error is encountered in the
user input. Try-and-catch statements are added in checkValidDeleteCmd()
to ensure that the delete command is valid before the task is being
deleted from the task list.

Changes to other methods such as main() and checkValidCommand() in
Yq.java are made because they need to account for the 'delete' keyword.
The chatbot Yq has gained another ability to delete task from the
task list as requested by the user.

commitResults.messageTitle: Include test cases for methods involved in deleting task into input.txt
commitResults.messageBody:
This enables discrepancy checks between the actual output and the
expected output when a task is being deleted.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add test cases into input.txt on marking of tasks before deleting
Create methods for creating, deleting and editing .txt file in Yq.java
commitResults.messageBody:
Additional methods have been added to allow retrieval of saved tasks in
.txt file and the changes made in the task list such as adding new task,
marking or unmarking task can now be saved in the .txt file, hence
updating the file.

commitResults.messageTitle: Edit the file path of Yq.java in both runtest.bat and runtest.sh
commitResults.messageBody:
This is to account for the change in the file location of Yq.java after
it is being moved into the ui package, so the test cases can run
smoothly.

commitResults.messageTitle: Save newly created saved_task_arraylist.txt containing the saved tasks
Merge branch 'branch-Level-6'
Merge branch 'branch-Level-7'
commitResults.messageBody: The conflicts are being handled.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add DuplicateTaskException.java into the exceptions package
commitResults.messageBody: This will be thrown when a duplicate task is being created.

commitResults.messageTitle: Create abstract method equals() in Task.java
commitResults.messageBody:
This is to allow the children classes to check if the newly created task
is equal to an existing task in the task arraylist or in the
saved_task_arraylist.txt file.

commitResults.messageTitle: Create equals() method in Todo.java
Create equals() method in Deadline.java
Create equals() method in Event.java
Refine codes and include methods which account for duplicate tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
For methods related to creating and checking new todo, deadline and
tasks such as createTodo(), makeValidTodo() etc., DuplicateTaskException
is incorporated into these methods and will be thrown whenever a
duplicate task is being created.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update the inputs in input.txt and test cases results in EXPECTED.TXT
commitResults.messageBody:
This is to account for new 'delete' and 'save' features which the
chatbot Yq is able to perform.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update the saved_task_arraylist.txt files
Remove saved_task_arraylist.txt
Make minor changes to the code
Improve code quality by removing recycled variables or parameters
commitResults.messageBody: It is to avoid bad coding practices.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove DuplicateTaskException.java
Add the respective error message to each exception when it is thrown
Add new exceptions and their respective error messages
commitResults.messageBody:
It is account for other errors which would be triggered by incorrect
user input.

commitResults.messageTitle: Make some minor code refactoring to improve readability
Make some minor adjustments to the test cases and the expected output
Make more Command classes for each type of user command input
commitResults.messageBody: It is to fulfil A-MoreOOP requirements.

commitResults.messageTitle: Create more Object classes relating to the operations done by chatbot Yq
Modify Yq to account for the Object-Oriented nature of the operations
